channel.title: [Website Development] Guthide - Multi-Player Java RPG
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://guthide.netne.net/img/logo.png[/img][/center]
Please note: The website is 100% mine, nothing is copyrighted from another site as everything was created by me. Also note: I am looking for GFX artists, please message me if you are good in things like photoshop. [b]For updates as soon as they come out [/b] - [url=http://guthide.netne.net]Here[/url] Will get a real domain once this starts rolling [b]Update Log[/b] [url=http://guthide.netne.net/topic.php?id=7]February Updates[/url]
Q: What is this project for ... exactly?
A: Originally, I set off to make a text-based RPG, but then I thought, Java would be more user-friendly and more fun. Also more work. The game would mostly identify with [i]Runescape Classic[/i] (until I get an actual big graphics team that can make 3d models).
Q: How many people are working on this with you, and are you looking for more?
A: My 3 brothers and I, I am head of website while my brothers, images, etc. We are looking for Java coders, and Image experts as you can see the images (including logo) are pretty poor. Have more questions? Leave Below for me to answer!

item.title: [Website Development] Guthide - Multi-Player Java RPG
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Allen s, post:12, topic:480487”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=598719.msg4210920#msg4210920 date=1359524792]

There’s a lot to be improved on, tables need to be taken away instantly, ALL styling should be done with CSS. Towards the photoshop comment, I myself am terrible with photoshop and image designing, I do most of my work with resources found on the internet. If you search and spend a little time you can create a massive bank of resources for free.

I started an operation to clean load all, if not most, of the styling via CSS. Making good progress so far! Look on the website news for more information. Even the small updates are the in the other news portion of the news.
[/quote]Your idea of IDs and classes are mixed up. IDs should only be used once per page and it’s recommended not to use them as styling hooks. Javascript hooks or page referencing is fine though.

[code=html]

Website Changes

29-Jan-2013

Recently the website was released publicly, there were many reasons as to why this was: A, for feedback. and B, pictures can only tell you so much, you actually


Read More
		<div id='news_head'>Looking for GFX Artists</div>
		<div id='news_left'>28-Jan-2013</div>
		<div id='news_content'>We are looking for GFX artists, if you know at least basic photoshop, we would like your help. Please just simply message Allen on Moparscape and send him a pic</div>
		<div id='news_img'><img src='img/news/3.png'></img></div>
		<div id='news_more'><a href='topic.php?id=8'>Read More</a></div>[/code]

Should be or <img src="img/logo.png />.

Will fix, CSS isn’t my strong point, and those are single quotes because of php.[/quote]Oh I wasn’t meaning the single quotes, was just saying you shouldn’t use an tag.

Read full topic

		<div id='news_more'><a href='topic.php?id=8'>Read More</a></div>[/code]

Should be or <img src="img/logo.png />.[/quote]

item.title: [Website Development] Guthide - Multi-Player Java RPG
item.dc:creator: @Allen_s Allen s
item.description:
@Allen_s wrote:

Ruby:

There’s a lot to be improved on, tables need to be taken away instantly, ALL styling should be done with CSS. Towards the photoshop comment, I myself am terrible with photoshop and image designing, I do most of my work with resources found on the internet. If you search and spend a little time you can create a massive bank of resources for free.

I started an operation to clean load all, if not most, of the styling via CSS. Making good progress so far! Look on the website news for more information. Even the small updates are the in the other news portion of the news.

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Development] Guthide - Multi-Player Java RPG
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Very original and modern design.

Honestly though you should look into semantic HTML. Using s with text like “Read more” or “click here” is also a usability issue. Your page doesn’t validate either.

Read full topic

item.title: [Website Development] Guthide - Multi-Player Java RPG
item.dc:creator: @Allen_s Allen s
item.description:
@Allen_s wrote:

SilentCJ:

Avoid tables for non tabular data, semantics first. Also, navigation inside a fieldset? hmm.

I was thinking that also, it was just easy for me to do, however down the road ill take the tables out, and make a better design. This is just to get things going. Plus I need it simple since my brothers and I r really bad at photoshop haha, on a side note: I have been cleaning up some of the mess I made in the document regarding semantics

[center][IMG]http://guthide.netne.net/img/logo.png[/img][/center]
Please note: The website is 100% mine, nothing is copyrighted from another site as everything was created by me. Also note: I am looking for GFX artists, please message me if you are good in things like photoshop.

For updates as soon as they come out - Here
Will get a real domain once this starts rolling

Update Log
February Updates

Q: What is this project for ... exactly?
A: Originally, I set off to make a text-based RPG, but then I thought, Java would be more user-friendly and more fun. Also more work. The game would mostly identify with [i]Runescape Classic[/i] (until I get an actual big graphics team that can make 3d models).
Q: How many people are working on this with you, and are you looking for more?
A: My 3 brothers and I, I am head of website while my brothers, images, etc. We are looking for Java coders, and Image experts as you can see the images (including logo) are pretty poor.

Have more questions? Leave Below for me to answer!
